uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class Scaler

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Scaler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public final class Scaler
extends java.awt.Component

Used to convert real world co-ordinates to and from screen co-ordinates. Once set up with a geographic region and a screen region the scaler can perform all the calculations needed to scale a point from one to the other.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Scaler

public Scaler()
Contructs an empty scaller, it WILL NOT work.

Scaler

public Scaler(GeoRectangle world,
              java.awt.Rectangle screen)
Construct a working scaler.
Parameters:
world - A GeoRectangle that defines the bounds of the geographic region to map to the screen.
screen - A Rectangle that defines the size of the on-screen area to map the 'world' into.
Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.awt.Component

setMapExtent

public void setMapExtent(GeoRectangle extent)
Changes the extent of the reagion of geographic interest the scaler will recalcualte the scale factor needed to fit this new region to the screen and subsequently notify all listeners of the change in scale. If a projection is in use then the extent will be projected before the scale factor is calculated.
Parameters:
extent - A GeoRectangle that defines the new region.

setMapExtent

public void setMapExtent(GeoRectangle extent,
                         boolean keepQuiet)
Changes the extent of the reagion of geographic interest the scaler will recalcualte the scale factor needed to fit this new region to the screen and subsequently notify all listeners of the change in scale ONLY IF keepQuite is false. This keepQuite option is designed to stop infinate rescaling of two viewers that are litening to each other for scale changes.
Parameters:
extent - A GeoRectangle that defines the new region.
keepQuiet - A boolean stating if the scaler should NOT tell listenres.

setProjectedMapExtent

public void setProjectedMapExtent(GeoRectangle extent)

setGraphicsExtent

public void setGraphicsExtent(java.awt.Rectangle extent)
Changes the extent of the reagion of the onscreen view in pixels the scaler will recalcualte the scale factor needed to fit this new region to the screen and subsequently notify all listeners of the change in scale.
Parameters:
extent - A Rectangle that defines the new region.

getMapExtent

public GeoRectangle getMapExtent()
Gets the geographic extent of the region currenly scaled to fit into the on-screen region.
Returns:
GeoRectangle the current map extent.

getProjectedMapExtent

public GeoRectangle getProjectedMapExtent()

toGraphics

public int toGraphics(double value)
Converts a single geographic scaler value into on-screen units. DO NOT USE TO SCALE a value that will be used in a CO-ORDINATE.
If you wish to scale a point use the point version.
Parameters:
value - The double to be scaled to on-screen units.
Returns:
int The on-screen units equivelent of value.
See Also:
toMap

toGraphics

public int[] toGraphics(double x,
                        double y)
returns the screen co-ordinate equvelent of a geographic point. It will both scale and TRANSLATE the point to the correct screen location. therefore ONLY USE TO SCALE CO-ORDINATE PAIRS.
Parameters:
x - The double that makes up the x part of the co-ordinate
y - The double that makes up the y part of the co-ordinate
Returns:
int[] The scaled values of x and y, int[0]=scaledx,int[1]=scaledy;
See Also:
toMap

toGraphics

public int[] toGraphics(GeoPoint p)
returns the screen co-ordinate equvelent of a geographic point.
Parameters:
p - The GeoPoint to scale to screen co-ordinates.
Returns:
int[] The scaled values of x and y, int[0]=scaledx,int[1]=scaledy;
See Also:
toMap

toMap

public double toMap(double value)
Converts a single screen units value into geographic unints. DO NOT USE TO SCALE a value that will be used in a CO-ORDINATE.
Parameters:
value - The int of the number of onscreen units to scale to geographic units.
Returns:
double The geographic equivelent of value.
See Also:
toGraphics

setScaleFactor

public void setScaleFactor(double scaleFactor)
Deprecated.  

Sets a new scale Factor, DO NOT USE. This is a very low level call that should not be available.
Parameters:
scaleFactor - A double for the new scaling factor

scalePolygon

public GeoPolygon scalePolygon(GeoPolygon poly)
Convinence method for scaling whole polygons to screen co-ordinates. After calling you may want to call GeoPolygon.toAWTPolygon();
Parameters:
poly - the GeoPolygon to scale.
Returns:
GeoPolygon scaled version of polygon.
